N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 4.41 - Executive order no. 41: establishing a comprehensive work force planning program

State Regulations
I, Mario M. Cuomo, Governor of the State of New York, recognizing the need for the State to develop work force planning systems, procedures and expertise which will identify occupational and technological
trends and needs within State government, to use its resources to train and
retrain State employees so as to meet those needs, and to provide State
management with work force data which will be used to improve the State's human
resource management system, do hereby establish the following: I. Comprehensive Work Force Planning Program. There is hereby created a work force planning unit to be
established within the Governor's Office of Employee Relations. This unit will
develop and implement a comprehensive work force planning program which will be
used to: a. identify programmatic, occupational, technological and demographic trends and changes which affect the

State's work force and offer training and retraining opportunities to respond
to such trends and changes; b. provide information, training, retraining and other resources to State
employees which will enhance their opportunities for career mobility and
advancement, while maintaining a stable State work force; c. develop information and ongoing systems
which will allow the State to shift its human resources from declining
occupations to occupations experiencing growth and technological
change; d. develop appropriate data
to assist management in decisions to combine, separate, add, or eliminate
programs or services; e. develop
appropriate data to facilitate decisionmaking in the event of future reductions
in force and to assist in identifying alternatives to employee
layoffs; f. serve as a means for
unifying the State's human resource management policies. The Director of Employee Relations shall consult with the
public employee organizations which represent State employees on the
implementation and use of the work force planning program. Where appropriate, public community colleges, four year
colleges, universities and private institutions in the State shall be utilized
in the training and retraining programs established pursuant to this

Order. The Director of Employee Relations shall submit periodic
reports to the Governor regarding the development, implementation and progress
of this program. II. Interagency Human Resource Management

Task Force. There is hereby created an Interagency Human Resource

Management Task Force, and its membership shall consist of the following: The

Director of Employee Relations (who shall serve as chairperson), the Director
of the Budget, the Director of State Operations, and the President of the Civil

Service Commission. The Interagency Human Resource Management Task Force will
be responsible for monitoring the implementation of the comprehensive work
force planning program with particular emphasis on facilitating and encouraging
interagency cooperation. Signed: Mario M. CuomoDated: May 25, 1984
